diagnosis.final_diagnosis: surgical site infection caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the identification of MRSA from cultures of debrided material showing a susceptible profile to vancomycin, clindamycin, and tetracycline, and resistant to erythromycin. Despite initial clindamycin susceptibility, the strain exhibited inducible clindamycin resistance, confirmed through D testing, following treatment failure and the need for surgical intervention.
